docs.snippet: Adrian Peterson, whose family life has been troubled, says he is trying to cope with the death in South Dakota of a 2-year-old son, who the police say was the victim of an assault....
docs.lead_paragraph: Adrian Peterson, whose family life has been troubled, says he is trying to cope with the death in South Dakota of a 2-year-old son, who the police say was the victim of an assault.
docs.abstract: Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson, whose family life has been troubled, says he is trying to cope with the death of his 2-year-old son, who police say was the victim of an assault by a man who lives with the boy's mother.

headline.main: For the Vikings’ Peterson, the Death of a Young Son Is Another Devastating Turn
headline.print_headline: For the Vikings’ Peterson, the Death of a Young Son Is Another Devastating Turn

docs.snippet: Condoleezza Rice, a member of the new college football playoff selection committee, will bring her deep knowledge of the sport and collaborative skills to the group’s deliberations....
docs.lead_paragraph: Condoleezza Rice, a member of the new college football playoff selection committee, will bring her deep knowledge of the sport and collaborative skills to the group’s deliberations.
docs.abstract: Greg Bishop On College Football column holds that former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice will draw on her diplomatic background and deep knowledge of football in her new role as a member of college football's playoff selection committee; notes that Rice's father John Wesley Rice played and coached college football.

headline.main: Rice Approaches New Role With Diplomacy
headline.print_headline: Rice Approaches New Role With Diplomacy

docs.snippet: The players’ rights movement in intercollegiate athletics escalated beyond talk last week when football players from Grambling State boycotted practice and forced the forfeit of a game....
docs.lead_paragraph: The players’ rights movement in intercollegiate athletics escalated beyond talk last week when football players from Grambling State boycotted practice and forced the forfeit of a game.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times Column contends that decision by Grambling State football team to boycott practice and forfeit game represents escalation of players' rights movement; holds that if college players and advocacy groups like National College Players Assn truly want to show solidarity, they will unite with the Grambling players who turned words into action

headline.main: Making a Stand for Reform at Grambling, and at the N.C.A.A.
headline.print_headline: Making a Stand for Reform at Grambling, and at the N.C.A.A.

byline.original: By ANDY NEWMAN and SAM ROBERTS

docs.snippet: In the days after Hurricane Sandy, the maestro of the New York City Marathon, Mary Wittenberg, wanted the race to go on. But New Yorkers rejected that idea....
docs.lead_paragraph: In the days after Hurricane Sandy, the maestro of the New York City Marathon, Mary Wittenberg, wanted the race to go on. But New Yorkers rejected that idea.
docs.abstract: Clyde Haberman Breaking Bread column interview with Mary Wittenberg, president and chief executive of New York Road Runners club; Wittenberg recounts hostility she encountered when she fought against cancellation of New York City Marathon following destruction of Hurricane Sandy.

headline.main: A Marathon and Its Maestro, Getting Back on Track
headline.print_headline: A Marathon and Its Maestro, Getting Back on Track
